trigger: We recently reported that prolonged exposure of human aortic endothelial cells ( HAEC ) to low shear stress flow patterns is associated with a sustained increase in the activated form of the transcriptional regulator nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) .

We recently reported that prolonged exposure of human aortic endothelial cells ( HAEC ) to low shear stress flow patterns is associated with a sustained increase in the activated form of the transcriptional regulator nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) .

Here we investigate the hypothesis that low shear - induced activation of NF-kappaB is responsible for enhanced expression of <extra_id_0> vascular cell adhesion molecule <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) resulting in augmented endothelial cell-monocyte ( EC-Mn ) adhesion and that this activation is dependent on intracellular oxidant activity .

trigger: Before exposure to low shear ( 2 dyn / cm2 ) for 6 h , HAEC were preincubated with or without the antioxidants pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( PDTC ) or N - acetyl-L-cysteine ( NAC ) .
Before exposure to low shear ( 2 dyn / cm2 ) for 6 h , HAEC were preincubated with or without the antioxidants pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( PDTC ) or N - acetyl-L-cysteine ( NAC ) .
